title: Guardiola convinced Xavi will one day become Barcelona manager
text:
Pep Guardiola is convinced that Xavi will one day follow in his footsteps to become Barcelona manager.

The Manchester City boss built his side around the legendary midfielder when he was in charge at the Nou Camp and is full of praise for his footballing IQ.

Xavi spent 17 years in the first team there and has established himself as one of the club's all-time greats given he was part of the club's golden era.

Xavi Hernandez has been backed to one day go on to become the manager of Barcelona

His achievements at the Nou Camp have seen him consolidate himself as an all-time great

Pep Guardiola, who worked with Xavi when he was Barcelona boss, is confident in his abilities

For Guardiola, there is an inevitability that Xavi will make a return to Spain to take charge of the club in the future.

'Sooner or later it will happen,' he said of the 39-year-old in an interview with Catalunya Radio.

'He is still very young, but it will happen.

'He understands football and has a lot of passion and dedication. He is brave and says things very clearly.'

After four years playing with Al Sadd in Qatar, Xavi went on to graduate to head coach of the Qatar Stars League side.
description: Xavi spent 17 years in the first team at Barcelona and has established himself as one of the club's all-time great players given he was part of the club's golden era with Guardiola convinced he will be boss.
